alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Windsor County through 600 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Baltimore, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Windsor, Cavendish, Baltimore, Perkinsville Village, Weathersfield, Ascutney, West Windsor, Springfield, Ludlow, Hartland, Perkinsville, Whitesville, Weathersfield Bow, Amsden, West Springfield, Brownsville, Ascutney State Park, North Springfield Lake Recreation Area and North Springfield. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 46 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
